error.signature: SIGSEGV: segmentation fault accessing null pointer via FFI call

verdict.summary: FFI functions returned or received a null pointer that was dereferenced without checking. Always validate pointers at FFI boundaries.

dead_ends.action: Ignore the null check because the C library 'should never return null'
dead_ends.why_fails: C libraries return null on error conditions; assuming non-null leads to segfaults

workarounds.action: Use NonNull or Option<NonNull> for FFI pointer types
Wrap FFI calls in a safe Rust API that validates all pointers

leads_to.condition: When wrapping FFI in Arc introduces ownership issues

preceded_by.condition: When linking against C libraries requires specific features

frequently_confused_with.distinction: E0507 is a compile-time borrow error; null pointer FFI is a runtime segfault from unchecked C pointers
